description: 20 prompts covering AddForce, AddImpulse, SetSimulatePhysics, SetActorLocation, AddActorLocalOffset, velocity, movement patterns.

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay adds an upward impulse of 1000 units to launch the actor into the air.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Launcher
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick adds a constant forward force of 500 units to the actor.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConstantPush
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddForce
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Force [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that pressing Interact toggles physics simulation on and off using SetSimulatePhysics.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PhysicsToggle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick moves the actor forward by 2 units per frame using AddActorLocalOffset.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SlowMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=2.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap teleports the overlapping actor to location (0, 0, 500) using SetActorLocation.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Teleporter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=500]
NODE n3: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.NewLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that when overlapped, enables physics on itself and adds an upward impulse of 2000.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_OverlapLaunch
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=2000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a vector variable TargetLocation. On Tick, lerp the actor's position toward TargetLocation at alpha 0.05.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SmoothMover
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=TargetLocation]
NODE n4: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick reads the MoveForward input axis value and moves the actor forward by that amount using AddActorLocalOffset.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_InputMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetInputAxisValue [AxisName="MoveForward"]
NODE n3: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.X [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Hit adds an impulse in the opposite direction of the hit normal multiplied by 500.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Bouncer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Hit
NODE n2: MultiplyFloat [B=-500.0]
NODE n3: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n2.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Impulse [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with two vector variables PointA and PointB and a boolean AtA starting true. On Tick, if AtA is true move toward PointA, otherwise move toward PointB. When distance to target is less than 50, flip AtA.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Patrol
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector
VAR PointB: Vector
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=PointA]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=PointB]
NODE n6: GetActorLocation
NODE n7: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n9.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n10.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Vector]
DATA n4.Value -> n7.B [Vector]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n5.Value -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n10.NewLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay waits 3 seconds, then enables physics simulation and prints Physics Enabled.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick rotates 1 degree on Yaw and moves forward 1 unit. This makes the actor move in a circle.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0,Yaw=1.0,Roll=0)]
NODE n3: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=1.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean IsHeavy. On overlap, if IsHeavy add force of 5000 upward, else add force of 1000 upward.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalForce
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsHeavy: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsHeavy]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=5000)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Speed set to 5.0. On Tick, multiply DeltaSeconds by Speed and move the actor forward by that amount.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_VariableSpeed
PARENT: Actor
VAR Speed: Float = 5.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap adds a downward force of 3000 to the overlapping actor every tick while they remain overlapped. On end overlap, stop.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GravityZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsOverlapping: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA true -> n2.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA false -> n4.Value [Bool]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick gets the actor location. If the Z position is below 0, set it to 0 using SetActorLocation. Print Clamped when this happens.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FloorClamp
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: BreakVector
NODE n4: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: MakeVector [Z=0.0]
NODE n7: SetActorLocation
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Clamped"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Vector]
DATA n3.Z -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.X -> n6.X [Float]
DATA n3.Y -> n6.Y [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Fire uses a MultiGate with 3 outputs. Output 0 adds impulse right, output 1 adds impulse left, output 2 adds impulse up.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MultiImpulse
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: MultiGate
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=500,Z=0)]
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=-500,Z=0)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500)]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick moves the actor up and down using a sine wave. Get game time, apply sine, multiply by 100, set the Z location.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SineWave
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetGameTimeInSeconds
NODE n3: Sin
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: GetActorLocation
NODE n6: BreakVector
NODE n7: MakeVector
NODE n8: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Input [Vector]
DATA n6.X -> n7.X [Float]
DATA n6.Y -> n7.Y [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n7.Z [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.NewLocation [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay enables physics and adds a forward impulse of 3000. After 5 seconds, destroy itself.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Projectile
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=3000.0]
NODE n5: AddImpulse
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Impulse [Vector]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Speed at 100. On Tick, multiply Speed by DeltaSeconds, move actor forward by that amount. On pressing SpeedUp, add 50 to Speed.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Accelerator
PARENT: Actor
VAR Speed: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
NODE n6: Event_InputAction [ActionName="SpeedUp"]
NODE n7: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n8: AddFloat [B=50.0]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=Speed]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]
EXEC n6.Pressed -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Value [Float]
